00015  m_numcolors = 17;

00017  m_alpha = 0;
00018  m_fadespeed = 1;
00019  m_dark = false;
00020  m_darkness = FADE_DARKNESS;

00027 /**
00028  * This function checks whether the palette is patched or not.
00029  * It has to look for a certain binary code, to know that...
00030  */
00031 bool CPalette::patchedPalette(byte *p_exedata, int m_episode)
00032 {
00033  // go to the offset where we check the patched code
00034  if(m_episode == 1)
00035   p_exedata += 0x441C;
00036  else if(m_episode == 2)
00037   p_exedata += 0x157D;
00038  else if(m_episode == 3)
00039   p_exedata += 0x153B;
00040 
00041  const byte palette_patch_array[] =
00042  { 0xB8, 0x0D, 0x00, 0xCD,
00043       0x10, 0xB8, 0x12, 0x10, 0xB9, 0x08, 0x00, 0xBB,
00044       0x00, 0x00, 0x8C, 0xDA, 0x8E, 0xC2, 0xBA, 0x04,
00045       0x00, 0xCD, 0x10, 0xBB, 0x18, 0x00, 0xBA, 0x1C,
00046       0x00, 0xCD, 0x10, 0xC3 };
00047 
00048  return (memcmp( palette_patch_array, p_exedata, 32 ) == 0);
00049 }
00050 
00051 /**
00052  * Reads the patched code and sets it up...
00053  */
00054 void CPalette::setupPatchedPalette(byte *p_exedata, int m_episode)
00055 {
00056  if(m_episode == 1)
00057   p_exedata += 0x13054;
00058  else if(m_episode == 2)
00059   p_exedata += 0x17784;
00060  else if(m_episode == 3)
00061   p_exedata += 0x19824;
00062 
00063  for( size_t i=0 ; i<16 ; i++ )
00064  {
00065   Uint8 r, g, b;
00066   r = 4*(*p_exedata);
00067   p_exedata++;
00068   g = 4*(*p_exedata);
00069   p_exedata++;
00070   b = 4*(*p_exedata);
00071   p_exedata++;
00072   setPaletteColour( i, r, g, b);
00073  }
00074  setPaletteColour(16, 0x00, 0xff, 0xff);
00075 }
00076 
00077 void CPalette::setupColorPalettes(byte *p_exedata, int m_episode)
00078 {
00079  // TODO: Try to add patching code for palette patches of mods here!
00080 
00081  // TODO: Here it will check, if the exe was patched with that code.
00082  if(patchedPalette(p_exedata, m_episode))
00083  {
00084   setupPatchedPalette(p_exedata, m_episode);
00085  }
00086  else
00087  { // Default Palette
00088   setPaletteColour( 0, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00);
00089   setPaletteColour( 1, 0x00, 0x00, 0xa8);
00090   setPaletteColour( 2, 0x00, 0xa8, 0x00);
00091   setPaletteColour( 3, 0x00, 0xa8, 0xa8);
00092   setPaletteColour( 4, 0xa8, 0x00, 0x00);
00093   setPaletteColour( 5, 0xa8, 0x00, 0xa8);
00094   setPaletteColour( 6, 0xa8, 0x54, 0x00);
00095   setPaletteColour( 7, 0xa8, 0xa8, 0xa8);
00096   setPaletteColour( 8, 0x54, 0x54, 0x54);
00097   setPaletteColour( 9, 0x54, 0x54, 0xfc);
00098   setPaletteColour(10, 0x54, 0xfc, 0x54);
00099   setPaletteColour(11, 0x54, 0xfc, 0xfc);
00100   setPaletteColour(12, 0xfc, 0x54, 0x54);
00101   setPaletteColour(13, 0xfc, 0x54, 0xfc);
00102   setPaletteColour(14, 0xfc, 0xfc, 0x54);
00103   setPaletteColour(15, 0xfc, 0xfc, 0xfc);
00104   setPaletteColour(16, 0x00, 0xff, 0xff);
00105  }
00106 }
00107 
00108 // adds a color onto the end of the palette and returns it's index.
00109 // if the palette is full, returns -1.
00110 char CPalette::addcolor(unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b)
00111 {
00112  if (m_numcolors >= 255) return -1;
00113  
00114  m_Palette[m_numcolors].r = r;
00115  m_Palette[m_numcolors].g = g;
00116  m_Palette[m_numcolors].b = b;
00117  
00118  m_numcolors++;
00119  return (m_numcolors-1);
00120 }

00126 void CPalette::setPaletteColour( Uint8 c, Uint8 r, Uint8 g, Uint8 b)
00127 {
00128  m_Palette[c].r = r;
00129  m_Palette[c].g = g;
00130  m_Palette[c].b = b;
00131 }
00132 
00133 // sets whether to use the "dark" (lights off) or not
00134 void CPalette::setdark(bool dark)
00135 {
00136  m_dark = dark;
00137  setFadeColour(0);
00138  fadeto( m_dark ? m_darkness : 0, FADE_SPEED_SLOW);
00139 }
00140 
00141 void CPalette::setdarkness(Uint8 darkness)
00142 {
00143  m_darkness = darkness;
00144 }
00145 
00146 void CPalette::setFXSurface(SDL_Surface *fxsurface)
00147 {
00148  m_fxsurface = fxsurface;
00149  SDL_SetAlpha( m_fxsurface, SDL_SRCALPHA, m_alpha);
00150 }
00151 
00152 void CPalette::setFadeColour(Uint32 colour)
00153 {
00154  SDL_FillRect(m_fxsurface, NULL, colour);
00155 }
00156 
00157 // returns the index of a color in the current palette with an RGB value
00158 // identical to the one given, or -1.
00159 int CPalette::getcolor(unsigned char r, unsigned char g, unsigned char b)
00160 {
00161  for(int i=0;i<m_numcolors;i++)
00162  {
00163   if (m_Palette[i].r==r && m_Palette[i].g==g && m_Palette[i].b==b)
00164    return i;
00165  }
00166  return -1;
00167 }

00169 ///
00170 // Fading Routines
00171 ///
00172 bool CPalette::in_progress(void)  // return whether or not a fade is in progress
00173 {
00174  return m_fade_in_progess;
00175 }
00176 
00177 void CPalette::fadeto(Uint8 alpha, Uint8 fadespeed)
00178 {
00179  if(m_alpha != alpha)
00180  {
00181   m_alpha = alpha;
00182   m_fade_in_progess = true;
00183   m_fadespeed = fadespeed;
00184  }
00185 }
00186 
00187 void CPalette::applyFade()
00188 {
00189  Uint8 current_alpha = getPerSurfaceAlpha(m_fxsurface);
00190  
00191  if( m_alpha!=current_alpha )
00192  {
00193   m_fade_in_progess = true;
00194   if( m_alpha>current_alpha )
00195   {
00196    if(current_alpha+m_fadespeed>m_alpha)
00197     current_alpha = m_alpha;
00198    else
00199     current_alpha += m_fadespeed;
00200   }
00201   else if( m_alpha<current_alpha )
00202   {
00203    if(current_alpha-m_fadespeed<m_alpha)
00204     current_alpha = m_alpha;
00205    else
00206     current_alpha -= m_fadespeed;
00207   }
00208   
00209   SDL_SetAlpha( m_fxsurface, SDL_SRCALPHA, current_alpha);
00210  }
00211  else
00212  {
00213   m_fade_in_progess = false;
00214  }
00215 }
